Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: bminata
Reviews.Content: The location is a bit farther than I thought. Behind Quincy and Elizabeth Towers, just across York Hotel. And it's uphill. But still within a walking distance. Room looked old but clean. Space is standard. Not large but not small either. Booked for a non smoking room but got a smoking room instead because the non smoking ones w/ large bed was fully booked. The syphoon on the sink broke down. When I checked looked like it was broken before and reattached with some tapes. Staffs are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location..”
Reviews.Author: Burçin k
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 10 minutes walk away from Orchard which is famous shopping road in Singapore. Hotel lobby was too small.. We have stayed in the executive room which was small but good, modern and useful furnished. It was also very clean and tidy. There were everything you need as a traveler in the room. Breakfast was not very good, but it was ok. Breakfast area was too small so if it’s crowded you had to wait for an empty desk.

Reviews.Title: “small room but good location”
Reviews.Author: srhan
Reviews.Content: we stayed 1 night but i can say that the room was quite small. But its location is 5 minutes walk to the orchard road. İf you have hurry in the morning its not easy to have breakfast because the breakfast room is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Nest @ Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Padmanabhan_K
Reviews.Content: i was in Singapore for a 3 night stay and i choose this hotel mainly because of its location. it was in orchard road. We had booked a Executive deluxe room. Exterior & Interior of the hotel was good and clean. Shocker was the size of the room. I have to call it a nest rather than the room. It was small and unacceptable. To be honest, Bathrooms were of the same size of the room. The room could accommodate only a king size bed. absolutely no space on the sides of the bed or in the front of the bed to walk around. apart from this aspect, the hotel got almost everything rite. Service was good. Staffs were helpful and i would've given a 4star if not for the size of the room. So i recommend this hotel if room size doesn't mean anything to you.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotel, things to be noted.”
Reviews.Author: Rolleu Jones C
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Very good hospitality. Helpful staff. Acceptable hardware. I had very good staying experience with most of the Far East series hotels in Singapore. They had very well manners, helpful and friendly staffs. I will be focused on Elizabeth hotel in this comment. The goods : 1. Convenient. Near to Elizabeth Hospital. Near to Paragon and one street away from Orchard Road. 2. Peaceful environment in the busiest district. 3. Staffs. 4. Hotel room are fine. Get the Deluxe or renovated. Well maintained. 5. Singapore public transport including taxi is very convenient. The to be noted : 1. Standard room hygene. Dusty wardrobe.Not suggest standard room. 2. Pool size is small and just nice to chill. 3. More of a traditional classy 4 star hotel, for fancy choice, the Quincy could be consider. 4. Price. Somehow become more pricey then before. 15% - 30% increased in rate. Visiting their website sometimes got promotion, most time stick with agoda is a better option. Who should consider staying here. 1. For medical purpose traveller. Near to Hospital. Newer room then york. 2. Business traveller. It may be one of the price friend choice in that area, and with a peaceful restaurant+restaurant for some private talks. Things not satisfied. For the previous stay, I had booked a family suite room for One single bed, one king bed, with spacious room size and sofa included. My mom asking for another bed, they shift us to a tiny standard room with dusty wardrobe and an extra bed. For the price I paid, actually it should be noticeable cheaper under that option. This is not a proper arrangement They should offer us a Deluxe Twin room with an extra bed, or just shift out the king size bed and move in two single beds, which is a more proper arrangement. I respond to the front desk, things are discussed in a good manners communications. and they mentioned will take this noted under my name, and sort out better arrangement options for our next stay. Hopefully they does, as this is one of my favorite hotel in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: gettalife
Reviews.Content: Only had one night in Singapore - so many hotels to choose - glad we got this one. ($23 taxi from Changi) Quiet, clean, 5 mins to walk down to middle of Orchard Road for shops. Orchard MRT (10 min walk). Took taxi to Marina Bay Tower ($7 Sing) for look over harbour & city ($20 ticket) Very good breakfast. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Kanyakoch
Reviews.Content: Located not far from Orchard Road about 10 minutes walk and close to MRT station. The guest room is fine though a bit dust found under furnitures (iron board is also old) Breakfast time during 7:30 - 8:30 a.m. is almost busy and need queing. However, there're plenty choices of food... good! The hotel reception is friendly only the porter didn't provide help enough as I have to call him twice (probably looking for guest with good tip?). Overall is good, convenient and reasonable price Will try this hotel again in next business trip and see how

Reviews.Title: “A quick trip”
Reviews.Author: HappyGolfer4720
Reviews.Content: Arrived early for quck trip, the hotel was very accomodating. very clean and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel”
Reviews.Author: nayuthia
Reviews.Content: Plus point is hotel located around orchard area. It's about 5 mins walk from paragon. However, the room and the hallway were very very old. It is so different from the photos provided on their website. One thing i hate the most is the cleanliness. Dusts are all over places that are not usually touched (back of the seats) and they dont even clean the toilet properly. I got dirt/rust on my water tap. Secondly, I had to change my room 3times until they got me a better room. First room they gave me was a double bed (i ordered a-king-bed room on my reservation), second room was finally a-queen-bed one but the room was superb smelly. It was supposedly a non-smoking-floor, but that particular room was unbearable. The concierge offered us to get it spray with a fresher but we insisted to move to another room. We finally moved to the third room and that one was better. Overall, the service was okay, breakfast was okay (food selection was not that many), location was good, but the hotel needed a refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “surprising”
Reviews.Author: meena_123_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a couple for 3 nights feb 4th. This hotel was surprisingly nice, the photographs do not do it justice. The rooms are modern and very clean with branded toiletries. The staff were really friendly and more than accomadating to your needs.Bernard at the front the desk was the most helpfull and also talked you through the map explaining the best routes around Singapore. The hotel is siutated a short walk away from Orchard Road the main shopping area, We used the MRT system on a daily basis and found this a easy way to get around Singapore. 3 days was about the right time in the beautifull city. Although there was still more to do in the City. Taxis are also cheap and from the airport there is a taxi base and you can get a taxi easily all the taxi's are metred and at no time did you feel you were being ripped off. I really enjoyed my stay at the Elizabeth it was in a convinient location and had really good facilities for the guest. Highly recommnded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: BangkokStu
Reviews.Content: A good budget hotel close to Orchard Road and Paragon mall. Staff were very friendly and very helpful. Room was clean, and nice touches such as fruit bowls in lift foyers. Would recommend for anyone heading to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Winter in my room”
Reviews.Author: Leo_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay nothing special, rooms are quite old and the aircon doesn't work, freezing all the time. Beds are okay to rest and that's it. No complaints about the Service! The hotel is walking distance to Orchard Rd, however because I am not a mad shopper it didn't make a lot of difference to me. If I go back to Singapore I would search for another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice but stingy and unfriendly.”
Reviews.Author: Dewidya
Reviews.Content: An old hotel but looks like it's been refurbished. very nice smell from the entrance, with no one opening the heavy glass door, not too gracious receptionist staff but fast check in (and check out) process, not too friendly room service but the food price is reasonable and taste really good! love the toblerone chocolate compliment. the executive room isn't too spacious but nice and clean. the pillow smell of damp and seems never been changed even we have asked to clean the room everyday. no free wifi which i think a bit stingy for the price that we've paid.

Reviews.Title: “One week stay”
Reviews.Author: Uwe G
Reviews.Content: Hi there, I was one week in Singapore. It was amazing. The hotel is getting a "very good". The people are amazing, professional and I felt really comfortable over there. The roomservice was excellent as well as the receptionists (they are soooo nice, friendly and beautiful)! The rooms were comfortable, the aircondition worked perfectly, but the carpet was not so clean as I expected. There was a I-Room available and the working there was great and easy. Breakfast buffet, good choice of everything and a great start into the day. The coffee excellent...also the service was great (btw Thanks Sofie for the great support each morning). The location was perfect. Silent enough for having rest, close enough to enjoy the Orchard Road and the Chinatown area...relly ok. Unfortunately the gym was out of order and the swimming pool small. Many greetings

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road hotel, middle of the road pricing, but very comfortable all the same”
Reviews.Author: Chillipeppa
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have pointed out, the choice of this hotel is influenced by its close proximity to Orchard Rd. I used to stay here a lot, but that was years ago before the days of Internet Bookings and I depended on the rates quoted at the airport hotel desk. It was indeed pleasant to have returned. I choose a hotel on 3 main things. 1) Free internet as hotels charge exorbitant rates for something that should be free. 2) Value for money and 3) Location. I was pleasantly surprised to have all 3 at the Elizabeth. (Although it would appear that some people on different rates ARE in fact charged extra for internet) They were very full on the weekend I checked in and I was fortunate to be upgraded to a room on their executive floor. The bed was extremely comfortable and the thread count on their sheets was impressively high, as was the quality of the cotton. Towels etc were equally good. I dont use the mini-bar other than to store beers I buy from the local store, and therefore found their lack of beer in the mini-bar fitted in with my needs. However, there were lots of noodle type instant soups provided and a constant request to inquire whether they needed replenishing. The shower was great, good pressure, lots of hot water and very invigorating with all the usual amenities, more than I would ever use. The in-room TV was a huge flat screen and has adequate channels to satisfy most travelers. Very important to me was the nice sized work-desk along with comfortable chair allowing me to spend a lot of time working in comfort. I was also pleasantly surprised to enjoy half priced drinks from 5 to 9 pm every day at all the public areas of the hotel. This makes a daily poolside trip almost compulsory! The complimentary breakfast was wholesome and most desires can be fulfilled at their buffet. I found the hotel to be in a continual state of upgrade and I guess this would explain their rather funky pub with no bar? One would expect to find a pub with a bar, but this one has to get its drinks from what appears to be the "old" bar which is situated in the dining room. It is an extremely unfriendly bar, as its bar counter is filled with dining room stuff like hot water urns. The bar counter has a nice foot rail, but not a single bar stool, so one gets the feeling that no one has paid any attention to the ambiance factor inside the public areas, and most people get the ambiance factor around the pool. However, whilst the half priced happy hours may attract a few folks like me, there is nothing more social about a busy little pub when one is travelling solo on business and it is usually nice to find like minded travelers with which to pass the time and enjoy a few drinks. Maybe this will change in the future upgrade plans. I do really enjoy the close proximity to the hustle and bustle of Orchard Rd/Scotts Rd and the location of this hotel is excellent if one is a shopper! I've tried to be as balanced as possible with this report and would end with the thought that given the same pricing, I would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired décor, but its proximity to Orchard Road makes it good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rambutaan
Reviews.Content: I suspect the main reason people stay at the Elizabeth is that it’s accommodation near Singapore’s shopping precinct of Orchard Road, without the Orchard Road Hotel prices. So the hotel is in a pretty good location – sure it’s not right on Orchard Road but it’s only a 10 minute walk through some side streets to get there. I’ve stayed at the Hotel Elizabeth about a decade ago, so it’s been a long time since I’ve visited. Unfortunately, the hotel décor is now a bit tired, but then again we were going for the basic rooms (I believe the deluxe ones have been refurbished). The rooms in the hotel are also quite small but provided you’re not carrying more than two suitcases, there should be sufficient space. Also, one of the rooms we stayed in happened to be right next to the elevator which you can hear through the walls – fortunately it didn’t wake us from our sleep as the beds were comfy enough. The TV was functioning well with a good selection of channels. Air conditioning, lighting and the hand basin taps all worked fine although we had issues when it came to showering as the temperature oscillated between scalding hot and freezing cold. So we had shorter showers! Reception staff at the hotel accepted my accommodation vouchers and settled accounts with a minimum of fuss. Other hotel staff were helpful in carrying bags to our rooms and we even managed to get an emergency roll of toilet paper late one night! In terms of facilities, the hotel has a swimming pool and also happens to be where Arsenal FC fans congregate. Wireless Internet was available for about $15SGD for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Not Bad service..”
Reviews.Author: AndienDarham
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the end of dec 2011 for 3 nights with my mom & my sister.. generally my stay was not bad, the hotel management quite easy going, while check out they not really check for the mini bar and everything.. What i like about this hotel is the location in mount elizabeth, which allowed me to walk to Orchard shopping center only with 15 minute walk.. The service are okay, i cannot say that it was excellent but the reception quite helping to assist for the late check out and provided information. For the cleanliness were okay, they only clean my room on lunch time hour.. which is not really matter for me..

Reviews.Title: “Liked almost everything”
Reviews.Author: MsDeeChiangMai
Reviews.Content: I don't really have anything bad to say about this hotel. The price was reasonable and the amenities for sufficient with all the nice extra touches like dressing gowns and tea stuff and slippers and toilet packs. Clean and comfortable. The in house restaurant is also nice and good value. Good spot for Orchard road. My only qualm would be the gym and the pool. The pool is not rain protected and they only had one of each machine. Howevery during my stay the running machine didn't work so they let me use the pool and gym at their sister hotel nextdoor - the Quincey, which were amazing. If the gym and pool are important to you - stay at the Quincey, if not, the Elizabeth should suffice.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynn91277
Reviews.Content: A reasonably priced hotel in an excellent location . Hotel staffs are friendly and efficient. Rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. Very good hotel facilities and amenities. I just hope that they will offer free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “unsuccessful refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: PieterdeN
Reviews.Content: This was the third and last time we stayed at the Elizabeth. They are trying to refurbish the rooms into a more boutiquish style, but it takes more than just redecorating, new furniture (only 1 chair) and restyling the bathroom to become a boutique hotel. We suffered from the very noisy airconditioning that was putting the room into a cold sauna. The humidity was terrible and all of the bedding was clammy and musty. Also the wifi rates are excessive in this hotel, but that seems to be a special Singapore treat.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in an upmarket location”
Reviews.Author: s_ramsam
Reviews.Content: This is pretty comfortable hotel in the Orchard road area of Singapore. Our family arrived in Singapore for a three nights stay at the hotel. The reception was efficient and the check in process was smooth. The rooms were good and quite spacious with comfortable chairs and an even more comfortable bed. Response of the housekeeping staff to our calls was good. Breakfast was ok. Lots of brochures about Singapore attractions were available in the lobby. We had no time for other amenities like the swimming pool etc. All in all, a very good hotel for a comfortable stay on a leisure trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Victa001
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel but a little over-priced when you consir what you get for your money. My shower rose did not work properly and the room furniture is out-dated needing upgrade. An ok hotel though!

Reviews.Title: “Must try before you die”
Reviews.Author: Julianjackman
Reviews.Content: Elizabeth.. Something royal, something mystical, immersed in history, almost illicit, once you enter the hotel you enter another world. I felt as if I knocked myself into a history book. Everyone was very polite and useful at the front desk. There's a lovely swimming pool on the first floor, gorgeous. The breakfast was mediocre and included the most tasteless eggs ever. Our room, was well proportioned, full of elegant charm and pleasure to stay in. I would be more than happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectation!”
Reviews.Author: LoveEli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a refurbished room and was great. What a sensational room. Great for business and romantic couples. Housekeeping, reception people were all fantastic friendly and obliging. The room you could not find fault, very very clean room and comfortable bed. Selection of fruits at hallway, nice touches but no replenishment for a day : ( otherwise, faultless!

Reviews.Title: “Good room, dirty hall”
Reviews.Author: d8350
Reviews.Content: Corner room on the 10th floor has plenty of widows, nice bath and reasonable size. Housekeeping has been very good in the room. The hallway is another matter. It's going on three days now without a vacuum. Plenty on the floor for snacking with what looks like potato chip pieces and other bits of food/dirt/etc. The lobby and dining room are clean, so it is odd they can't bother to clean the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I've experienced”
Reviews.Author: dse8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the complete opposite of what Singapore is, very dirty and unorganised. The only positive thing that comes to my mind about it is the location, reasonably close to Orchard Rd. - Staff communication: They are unable to comprehend British or American English. They mixed the reservation dates and woke us up at 6am instead of the requested time of 8am. - Breakfast: Horrible, beyond any description. Very bad quality... - Cleanliness: Mildew in the bathroom. The carpet in the room was very badly stained. - Air-conditioning noise: Way too much. - Sound insulation: Could hear everything from the neighbouring rooms, especially from their toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BubuCake
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is tucked away behind Orchid Street. So it does take a bit of distance walking. The rooms are really small and so is the bathroom. There is only ONE restaurant where you can dine.. It wasn't BAD.. however I would not back here if I was to return to Singapore.. Much more better hotels out there.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price for this location”
Reviews.Author: Romuluz75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Elizabeth for a couple of nights, paid SGD240+ for each night. I would say this is good value for its location close to Orchard Road, though the steep walk uphill would be tiring and uncomfortable in this humid weather. The room is a bit worn out and could do with better maintenance. Breakfast is acceptable for the money paid. Upon entering the room after check-in,the card slot for power didn't work, but this was attended too in quick order after a call to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, comfortable stay とてもよかった”
Reviews.Author: thejetsettress
Reviews.Content: 日本語の口コミも下にあります！ Location is very good, right at the side of orchard road, walking to paragon took i think 10 minutes maximum (I'm slow). Beds were very comfortable, they were generous in giving extra pillows. Service was nice. They made up the bed every time. And one time I left something in the robe, I rushed to call the hotel from shopping to ask that they leave the robe behind and they did. One time they placed free toblerones beside the lamp, very nice turn down service. :D Very good! Although price was very expensive since we stayed during the F1 weekend. Suggestion: Try eating from the Food Republic! you get all sorts of inexpensive cuisine! Try home made Iced Lemon Tea from hawkers. Wee Nam Kee snacks were yum. Chinese food: the best is DIN TAI FUNG!!! delicious Xiao Long Bao! And of course, the stars of Singaporean cuisine: Chilli crabs (best is Long Island, near airport), and Cereal Praws (best is No signboard, by marina bay) 部屋は快適でした。ベッドもよかったし、バスルームも広かったし！ホテルの位置はorchard道にあると思いますが、買い物にベストロケーションです！夜お風呂に入るのは最高でした。 おすすめ： ホーカー （小さいお店）の home made lemon iced tea はおいしかった! 日本料理はまあまあでしたが、インド料理、中華、フィリピン、タイ、インドネシア料理を全部試したのでうれしいです！ 中華料理なんですが、No Signboard のchili crabs と cereal prawns はすごくおいしかった！chili はもちろん入っているんですが、そんなに辛くないと思います。 Universal Studios なら、USJ のほうがぜんぜん大きいです！ですけれども、ぜひUSSをお楽しみください！

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff and service.”
Reviews.Author: Mike999a
Reviews.Content: Overall review rates this hotel 3star class with 4 star services. We had a comfortable room and staff were very helpful and friendly. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay”
Reviews.Author: graypj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel for six nights, arriving very late our first night but check-in was fast, got an upgrade, not sure what that meant. Put on 10th floor, heard some const. going on on 7th.floor but ok.My husband was gone during day so I was by myself and everyone looked after me very well, especially Sophie serving me at meals, Got tired of same food for buffet breakfast and very expensive (23.00)each morning.Need to have more simplier meals for less $ available all day.Supper menu very expensive. Room ok, quite small for price.Bathroom very small, everything clean except our floor was not vacuumed everyday. maid service good, room always made up early in am.Staff were all great and helpful. Walk to shopping was fine both going & coming back (I'm in my 60's).We enjoyed our stay...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Singapore at the Elizabeth for 3 days. We had a great time. Doorman and bellboy were very helpful and handled our luggage with a smile. In fact when we were leaving we had family pick us up and told the doorman we did not need assistance with anything. they still helped us with the luggage and thanked us for the stay. Other than the noise from the construction below us everything was great. I very much enjoyed the aromotherapy body wash, shampoo and lotion (bad sunburn) these products helped very much and i am sorry i did not ask about them and how to get more. The restaurant was pleasant and food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back soon...”
Reviews.Author: Hotelsucker
Reviews.Content: Well, I stayed for 2 nights, I wonder whether my testimony could be not entirely prejudicial. The doorman were a bit absent in minded. Upon my arrival, they did not assist much and failed to greet me at the first place. Efficient check in counter. The breakfast was truly uninspiring. Efficient house keeping service, the 2 dental kits requested were delivered with secs. Amazing! the duty staff of the concierge were somehow lukewarm. Overall, great experience. will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back...”
Reviews.Author: Hotelsucker
Reviews.Content: Well, I stayed for 2 nights, I wonder whether my testimony could be not entirely prejudicial. The doormen were a bit absent in minded. Upon my arrival, they did not assist much and failed to greet at the first place. Efficient check-in counter. The breakfast was truly uninspiring. Efficient house keeping service, the 2 dental kits requested were delivered with sec. Amizing. The duty staff at concierge were somehow lukewarm. Overall, great experience. Will be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loving it”
Reviews.Author: KLBen
Reviews.Content: Everything was great!! Just that it does not provide food for room service after a certain time at night.

Reviews.Title: “No Warning about RENOVATIONS!”
Reviews.Author: WaOzabout
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, for leisure after a business trip, checking in after a late flight on a friday night, was told 'sorry, we are renovating on the 6th floor, it could be noisy between 9am - 5pm, hope you won't be in your room during the day!! They then checked me into a room on the 7th floor! - right above the hammering and drilling. I am heavily pregnant and was trying to get a short afternoon nap, at 4.45pm - thinking the noise will stop at 5 as told. Even with silicon earplugs in, it didn't stop the noise. Called reception at 5pm, they said it will finish at 5pm..... it continued until 6.30pm - when i left for the evening. I was going to change hotels, but they asssured me they don't 'work' on Sundays. so i stayed. Sunday morning, the hammering started again at 9.30am. I was then told 'they are working from 10am - 1pm' hmmm This hotel is definitely in need of renovations, it's outdated and shabby. The breakfast is less than average. I find it hard to believe they still charge full price for rooms in this situation. Why place guests on the 7th floor, when renovations are happening. Eveyone should be automatically moved further upstairs! I asked - and was refused. They then also charged me for an extension check out time - as i needed more sleep before my flight that night, which i couldn't get, again, due to the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied customer...”
Reviews.Author: jcd17
Reviews.Content: We were 3 adults and 1 child, they offered an extra bed with no charge. That is a plus plus for me. Our room was very small though. They have very friendly staff as well (mostly Filipinas on the front desk). Location is good, near Orchard road. You can walk from the hotel to the shops since it's downhill but take a cab from Orchard back to the hotel since you will be walking uphill with plenty of bags from shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with not a very great service”
Reviews.Author: dalozt
Reviews.Content: During my stay, the check in was great and very swift. But the room attendant was very rude. When they brought in extra bed, the lady in front of me saying to her friends "oh my God, I will be dead to clean this room tomorrow". The breakfast was too crowded and we have to queue for almost 30 minutes..

Reviews.Title: “Never experience such service”
Reviews.Author: Mustafa60
Reviews.Content: No courtesy by the staff. Their attitude is like we have received iur oayment now you go to hell. They are having renovation on uper floors. Apology letter mention the it will take place from 11 am to 5 pm, where as it start at 9am continue till 7:30 - 8:30 pm or later sometime. At 7:30am their gardener trim grass with power trimmer next to my window. It took 45 min to open the connecting room doors after making two phone calls and two trip to reception. House Keeping, Conceirge, front desk staffs doesn't pick up phones when they are busy.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended. Look elsewhere, first.”
Reviews.Author: eddbot
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this review short and sweet, as I only have 15 minutes to write this review (which I've paid $2.15 for). I'll try to keep this as accurate as possible, as it's hard to concentrate with incessant banging and drilling from the renovations this hotel is conducting. Pros: location, it's approximately 7 minutes to Orchard Road's shopping and eateries. There's a food court in the basement floor of Lucky Plaza, with a McDonald's and other international cuisine. it's also, approximately a 12 minute walk to Orchard MRT station. Cons: stayed on the 7th floor, above a floor where they're doing construction/renovation. i woke up at 9am due to loud banging/drilling. we were left a note in our room, warning us of the noise between 9am-5pm due to renovations, but the noise is unbearable. no internet included. rates start at $2.15/15 minutes to approximately $16/24 hrs. this hotel is really no frills. decor and furniture in the rooms are quite a bit dated. this hotel is priced about $50/night less than other hotels in the Orchard Road area, but I'd highly recommend looking elsewhere, first. if location is the only concern, this hotel is okay, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Yousuf007
Reviews.Content: Goods: 1. The check-in guy was very helpful. I think his name was Bernard. 2. Stayed in executive room. Room was big and they had free laundry and free minibar. Though minibar items were very limited. Free Newspaper. 3. Housekeeping was prompt. 4. As I was seeing some doctors at nearby Mt. E hospital so the location was very helpful. Only 10 mins walk downhill. But the uphill walk to hotel was tiring. 5. Orchard road was very close and lots of choice of shops and foods and shopping. 6. Did not find any dining room service menu in the room. So don't know if they had any Bads: 1. Early check-in was not allowed. late checkout not allowed. 2. extension of stay by one night not allowed, Hotel full. Though I told them I am a patient at a hospital. I think they could have found one room for 1 night. But the reception lady and the manager said no. 3. Breakfast was limited and same items every day. 4. Hotel needs renovation. Looks getting old.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Orchard without the Hustle & Bustle of that busy street”
Reviews.Author: Ria-chan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days but was always out so can't say much about the service of the staff. The room was ok although my window was not really facing a nice view. I enjoyed the breakfast buffet, not as grand as Shangri-la's but pretty much plenty of options (food is friendly to a foreigner's stomach). Tried ordering for lunch and dinner as well, they've got good food! Pool was ok, though it was pretty awkward to swim alone with a lot of passers-by. And that time, there was a building being constructed behind the hotel (Feb 2008). I also booked a trip to Malacca through their tourist desk at the reception. Ticket was delivered very late in my room (was just slipped under the door). In any case, would still consider checking in again if required to stay near the Orchard area. Closest way to the road would be to pass through the back entrance of Paragon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel @ nice location”
Reviews.Author: couple06
Reviews.Content: The location is near orchard road but not in a busy area, really nice to walk along the street. The room we got was quite small with old furniture, but we love the cleanliness of the room and the kindness of the staffs . We think the hotel needs new furniture to meet customers' satisfaction,but overall it was still a pleasure to stay @ The Elizabeth Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: doogiehowser_md
Reviews.Content: Nice location being a very short walk to the shopping in Orchard Rd but far enough away that you would think you were in a quiet residential area. Tidy rooms, nothing special but not hideous. Awesome pool for families. Good vale

Reviews.Title: “Good Place and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AksSun
Reviews.Content: Excellent location of this hotel. Near to the famous malls and centers of Singapore, the hotel offers excellent value for money. Must stop for travelers who are looking to unwind after a long day at the shopping havens of Singapore. Definitely Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing to say the least - dirty”
Reviews.Author: noriffraff
Reviews.Content: Arrived early in the morning - and staff unable to assist with anything - finally later when I got the room, carpets dirty, found a dead bug in the room and finally to top things, got bitten by something here. Not worth the money - however the location is decent - but I would recommend spending a few dollars more and get a better place - there are others that I have stayed at that is reasonable around this place. If you can help it, avoid especially with family and kids.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the city but quietly tucked away”
Reviews.Author: Pramodh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a holiday and found the property very strategically located off Orchard Road. Since it was just off the main road we were close to all the action but the property was very quiet. The rooms were quiet spacious and food was good. Staff were very courteous and helpful. Would recommend this property for people who want to shop and eat and be in central Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Sad To Say - Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: i_travel_2_eat
Reviews.Content: Dislikes: F/O staff could not find our reservation Consequently, during our stay, we could not get phone calls because we are "not checked-in" One staff at the breakfast room wearing heavy rings on all fingers!!! Not the best customer service, or maybe because the staff members are tired, saw them serving at breakfast, then saw them serving dinner too. Only one restaurant and one pub. Hotel website says "free shuttle to Universal Studios" - there's none. Found out after a night out that the housekeeping staff left our room unlocked. Breakfast items are limited. Likes: Pool is very clean. F/O staff Bernard at check-out is very efficient and nice. Housekeeping staff are cordial. 4 lifts for a small hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Richo12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Elizabeth Hotel for 2 nights in march. Whilst the staff were very helpful, I found the room very small and not really comfortable. The breakfast was very ordinary - I only enjoyed the fresh fruit. Would not stay here again - if I was to stay in this area again, I would stay at the York which is opposite the Elizabeth.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Otherwize Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: felixinbali
Reviews.Content: I booked the executive room through hotelclub.net which I thought would be a bit spacier and nicer overall for a one week stay. However, after I checked in and went up to the room I was shocked how small the room was. Something like a room in a 3-star hotel. They gave me another room which was a littler better and had a double bed. Next the internet (rate was incl.) was not working from either cable or wifi. Complained and was given a premium executive room. That room was much spacier and overall fine and the internet was working with Wifi (cable not). The hotel has no egg corner so no fresh made eggs and the scrambled eggs they had prepared looked really disgusting. I ordered fresh eggs from the waiter which did not look much better. The hotel's location is good and just a 5 minute walk to Orchard Road (Scotts Road) and Orchard MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff. A terrible old hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaTaiwan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb location just off the Orchard road and the staff are all pleasant. The hotel however needs some serious up dating in terms of decor and furnishings, all of which have seen much better days. My husband & I stayed in an executive room, our room was not very clean, a terrible shame. I understand the hotel next door " The Quincy" is also run by this hotel which looks sharp, new and contempory. My husband & I would rate the Elizabeth hotel a 3 star at best!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth 3 star rating”
Reviews.Author: 255100Traveler
Reviews.Content: Good: The location was perfect, which was why I booked it. Not so good: My room was at the rear of the elevator shaft so the mechanical noise of metal against metal occurred all night long and was very unsettling. The room was small and my one suitcase could barely fit which made walking around the room uncomfortable. I couldn't get my wi-fi going so two different staff members came at separate times to assist. Neither could get it going so both staff members came up with the solution of calling for telephone tech support. Unfortunately the telephone was by the bed and nowhere near the desk where the computer was plugged in so support was only possible via mobile phone. Despite two hours taken out of my one day in Singapore, I had to accept the fact that wi-fi was not going to work at the Elizabeth Hotel in Singapore! And this despite the fact that I'd had no problem with wi-fi in Delhi, where it had been fully functioning for the week prior! I ordered bircher muesli from the room service breakfast menu and received muesli instead. When I called to advise the mistake, the staff didn't seem to understand that there was a difference, and the restaurant manager whom I was put through to, said that bircher muesli had not been available for a long time and expressed his annoyance that it still remained on the room service menu. No-one apologized or offered any alternative. Coffee ordered via room service was so bitter it was undrinkable and came already poured into a single small cup so that it was no longer hot when it arrived. No pot of coffee was provided, only this small cup of luke warm bitter coffee. When I advised that the ironing board could not be adjusted into a standing position, little attention was paid to me and I had to call again to request that someone come and either fix it or replace it. It had to be replaced because housekeeping also found it to be faulty. Again, no apology and their lack of immediate attention caused me to be late. The replacement ironing board was so low in it's upright position, ironing had to be done from seated position, and the iron was dirty and marked my white linen skirt. All in all, the Elizabeth Hotel in Singapore is well located but you'd be best not to expect things to work too smoothly if you choose to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisettour
Reviews.Content: The staff is extremely nice and helpful. The location is quite good since it's in a quiet area, and at the same time it's still very close from the shops and restaurants. The restaurant of the hotel is rather good also. One bad point for this hotel: the internet is extremely expensive, when it should be part of the booking...

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: iworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is approximately 10mins walk to Orchard rd shopping district, nothing special, has all the bare minimal items. Most disappointing is the gym facility, two old rusty equipment, placed outside near the pool. I should of stay at their other hotel "Orchard Parade"

Reviews.Title: “Nothing extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: undome
Reviews.Content: We ended up having to book a hotel after we'd already arrived in Singapore (something I never do, or recommend for others to do). Through the Visitor's Centre on Orchard Rd we managed to get a room for our five -day stay, but definitely did not have a lot of choice. Anyhow, the hotel is what you'd expect from a slightly better rate accommodation: spacious, clean and well-serviced. The room was not gigantic, but definitely large enough. Bed and pillows were not too soft, but that's how I like to sleep anyway. Only complaints really would be on the a/c, which was way too cold and you could not adjust the temperature so the only option was to turn it off (it would also automatically go on when you removed the room key from the electricity-switch). Also, our hand towels disappeared after the first day, and we never got a replacement. The hotel pool was fine, extra points for outside showers. A jug of Tiger costs around $40, so not too expensive. We had some issues with the location. It takes 10 mins to walk to Orchard Rd, around 15 to get to the Orchard MRT station. Also, it's up a hill and there are 3 busy hospitals on the street, so walking in the heat can get rather annoying.

Reviews.Title: “" Hold on the line "”
Reviews.Author: adriaanhamm1
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to be a guest in the Elizabeth. Thank you. Greetings, A.Hamm

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: dentility
Reviews.Content: i was absolutely satisfied with the hotel,right from its location,the warm welcome,ever smiling staff and above all the convinience of being located 5 min walking distance of the shaopping paradise and central business district of singapore. the rooms were luxuriously laid out with all modern facilities that one can think of including an expresso instant coffee machine.definitely wud stay here again if i visit singapore in future.

Reviews.Title: “I like the hotel because the location very strategic”
Reviews.Author: karentambayong
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: I like it because its close to Orchard where I always go to the book store at KINUKINIYA at food at PARAGON and WISMA ATRIA and close to BOTANICAL GARDEN. SERVICE: Front desk sometimes doesn't always give the good service, when its shift sometimes they didn't get the message from the earlier group. But their effort to be helpful is appreciated . I like the room its efficient I like the restaurant with the best water features I don't like the plastic flower arrangement it's so fake, once I bought flower Orchids and I put it in the lobby to make me feel more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “outdated big time”
Reviews.Author: Hitch71
Reviews.Content: This is just a boring and outdated hotel with little charm.

Reviews.Title: “Not to the standards that they say”
Reviews.Author: SCtravelling
Reviews.Content: Ended up at the Elizabeth hotel last minute as a stop over to New Zealand so booked through hotel reservations at Singapore Airport. It cost s$220 to get a deluxe room for 1 night (had to go for deluxe over superior in order to get early check in). Got to the hotel and was told there were no double beds available, only twin rooms unless we wanted to wait for a later check in (after a 12 hour flight this wasnt what we wanted). Arrived at room to find it was already occupied - went back to reception to inform, he then gave us another key card to a room on the 7th floor. It was small, poxy, overlooking a building site and there was dust covering the tv and shelves. I complained and said that I did not consider it to be to a deluxe standard. Luckily Walton was quite accomodating and upgraded us for free to a smoking executive double room. I still dont think the rooms and decor are up to date and could do with a make over but we slept well and it was very close to Orchard road and shops.

Reviews.Title: “No temperature control in the rooms (fake thermostat)”
Reviews.Author: Canonista
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a pretty good location, being close to Orchard Road, but is a bit far from the nearest MRT station. Not a big issue if you don't mind a 10 minute walk. Breakfasts are great, plenty of choices, and service is good. As is often the case, the shower could be improved on (shower head points almost straight down, forcing you to stand against the shower wall). The rooms are old, lots of grime around the air duct, but okay. There is a thermostat on the wall that you can fiddle with, but is non-functional (according to the hotel, it is for the "central cooling system" but actually does nothing). You can set the fan speed to low, medium, or high on a panel by the night table, or turn the AC off. That's your only control. My room was 20 deg C, too cold for me. My room was on the 12th floor, supposedly one of the choice floors of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Squarely average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: FoodEnthused
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, easy walking distance to Orchard Road. I guess that makes up for what the hotel lacks. The service is non-existence: Don't expect any help with your heavy luggage, the "bellboys" will ignore you; and the reception staff are completely oblivious to guests standing in front of them. Strange. The rooms are very average, but it will do since we won't spend much time in the hotel room anyway. However, our biggest gripe is the damp-smelling shower curtain that emits a stale and lingering odour in the bathroom and bedroom. We have stayed here at least three times, and each time the shower curtains reeked. If you don't need one, make sure you don't get a room with an adjoining door - otherwise you can hear everything that is going on in the neighbouring room. Talking, coughing, what have you - we lost sleep in the early morning over this.

Reviews.Title: “Poor in-room TV Channels - No 2010 FIFA World Cup TV channel”
Reviews.Author: Archer_Kit
Reviews.Content: It is within 5-10 minutes walk to Orchard Road, but the distance could be a challenge for elderly travelers and family with kids. The T-Junction which nearby Elizabeth Hospital is quite heavy traffic, so be careful when crossing the T-junction here. I'm disappointed with the in-room TV channels. Limited TV channels are available in the rooms and don’t expect your kids can find theirs all-time favourite and cartoon programmes such as ‘Cartoon Network’ channel here. Besides, you should avoid this hotel if you’re FIFA Soccer World Cup 2010 supporter. This 4 stars hotel is not FIFA 2010 friendly at all – they do no have FIFA live telecast program for in-room TV channels. You gotta depend on CNN channel’s latest breaking news text line. What a shame! The room and facilities are modest and not up to 4 stars hotel standard. Nothing special about this hotel. Price is comparatively expensive during high season.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwiwhy
Reviews.Content: Everything is OK. But for TV channel it's only a few channel available there should be more channel especially when using TV cabale ( pay channel ) such as music channel, etc. Also for the bathroom there always noise from the drainage line, everytime we use washbasin there always noise from this drainage line sometimes i got a bit upset with that noise.

Reviews.Title: “Personal & relaxing”
Reviews.Author: joshmachine6
Reviews.Content: We had a personal experience at the hotel with a good breakfast package. Staff was very courteous and helped us with our itinerary and routes for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, disappointing and unclean”
Reviews.Author: TimLondon29
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in late April and expected a reasonably modern hotel up to the standard of 4 star hotels you find around Singapore. We were disappointed. In short our hotel room had the following problems: - hair in the bed and bath - a room with an adjoining door which was thin enough to let through the sounds of our neighbour who clearly had some lung complaint - a smell of cigarette smoke despite us being on a "non-smoking" floor. When you add to this the mildly disinterested desk staff and walk to orchard road (too close for a cab but too far to walk in the rain or heat) it doesn't do the hotel any good. The hotel restaurant - Modesto's - sums this place up. Very modest indeed. There are plenty of hotels in Singapore which offer competitive rates with excellent service and attractive rooms - this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Our first time to Singapore - Good choice staying at The Elizabeth Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lionsbay
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nites at The Elizabeth at the beginning of May. The location was perfect, walking distance to Orchid St. We found the hotel to be very clean, and the front desk staff to be helpful. The pool area was good, but do note that there is a high rise being built next door, quite close, and is a bit daunting, when you are sitting out on pool deck looking up. Breakfast is not included in rate, but did find it to be quite basic. Our room was quite adequate and clean. We decided to stay on our return a couple of weeks later, and we were upgraded to a lovely suite. We were very pleased with this hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it to others. We found the person at the tour desk very helpful, we booked a city tour which was excellent. Many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Joengmsia
Reviews.Content: Last month I went to Singapore and stay in this hotel in Orchard Road, The Elizabeth Hotel.Is not a five star hotel but I think their service is as good as a five star hotel staff. I was most welcome into the hotel and at that time I feel like home. The room was magnificent and clean.

Reviews.Title: “really too far from orchard road”
Reviews.Author: Naty833
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite nice if you don't mind the long walk to Orchard Road. Walking to the main street takes around 15 minutes and taking a cab is way too expensive. Not shuttle offered by the hotel. Getting to the hotel after a day of touring is not fun at all. Rooms are pretty small for a 4-star hotel. Hardly any space for an extra bed... it's that small. We upgraded to an executive room but everything was the same except for nicer bedsheets, wifi and unlimited drinks at their executive pavillion. There's a small pool and an (very limited) outdoor fitness gym, which I never got to use because of the scorching heat in Singapore. Complimentary shuttle to Universal Studios offered by the hotel a plus but limited to just 6 persons per trip so we ended up taking a cab. But the room was really clean and the bed comfortable. The bathrobes in the room were thick and very white. I don't know if they changed our sheets on the second and third day though... they were clean but a bit crumpled. They have Filipino hotel receptionists which made it easier to converse and ask for tips with regard to tourist attractions and places to eat. The concierge wasn't that helpful though.

Reviews.Title: “Elizabeth - Nothing Regal nor Elegant about this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissReviews
Reviews.Content: I quote: "This is the worst hotel in the world and the worst service I have ever seen." I said upon arrival. This hotel needs to improve. Not a great way to create a first impression nor start a week long business trip severely disrupted by the Ash Cloud. I say this not because it is a 1 or 2 star, but for spending 1500SGD for 5 nights (1 night no show), you would expect much more! We had no choice to choose Elizabeth because Singapore was busy for the Food Festival. I was charged for no show and extension of one night would cost 700SGD for a deluxe room, post Ash cloud. Rate on average was 180SGD-380SGD increasing by the day, no internet, no breakfast, very poor value for money. Concierge that did not care. Reservation staff that are not courteous and have an attitude problem, general manager or senior reservation staff that turn a blind eye when irate and dissatisfied guests expressing concern or complaint. Not sure of star rating, but not even a 4 star in my standard and not worth the money during high season. If you are paying high room rates, add 100SGD and upgrade to the Royal Suite, a world of difference, comfy big bed, spacious room and bathroom, except plentiful of ants! Breakfast is not worth paying the price, go outside and we did not even know that the Suite could get you into a private F&B area for proper coffee and beverages. I left this hotel still with no intention to return but the only good thing about this hotel is a) Location, less than 10min from Orchard if you can bear the heat and b) Mr Kew Wai Leong, Guest Relations Manager. Sincerely, if it werent for you Mr. Leong, this establishment has no chance in surviving and hope that your colleagues and management recognize that you are the only person that understands and provides great hospitality that you would expect from a country like Singapore. I have seen, been received, and experienced better service from remote places in China, Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines and Thailand. Elizabeth should be replaced by the hip brother Quincy.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay - convenient and safe”
Reviews.Author: VPeter
Reviews.Content: 10 minutes walk to Orchard Road. There is shortcut through Paragon Shopping Mall, opposite The Elizabeth Hospital main entrance. 15-20 minutes taxi drive to Clark Quay. A few taxis line up outside the hotel / along the Elizabeth link road, so no problem to get taxi. Free shuttle to Universal Studio/Sentosa Island, but not to airport. Our room was cleaned daily. The room facilities are average, all in working condition except our room table lamp was not in order.

Reviews.Title: “Good locatoin and good price”
Reviews.Author: Konake
Reviews.Content: I’ve been to Singapore a couple time so I decided to try this Hotel. From my experience, I stayed there for three nights and I have no complaints at all about the hotel. Clean hotel and the staff are friendly and helpful. I would recommend people to stay.

Reviews.Title: “As Comfortable As You're Ever Going to Be”
Reviews.Author: PilotMike2009
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the Elizabeth Hotel, 24 Mount Elizabeth Street, Singapore. Each time has been very pleasant and trouble-free, and this was no exception. The hotel is a relatively modern facility of 12-15 stories or so, with a small restaurant and bar on the main floor. As near as I can tell, it does not have a business center nor any meeting rooms; it's purely a hotel. The location is superior. It's a five-minute walk down the hill to the Paragon Shopping Center and Orchard Road, which really is the heart of commercial Singapore. The shopping, people-watching and the dining options are unmatched. I recommend ANY of the restaurants across Orchard Road in Tagashimaya (sp?) Plaza on the 4th floor, and "Emerald Row" three blocks to the left is a string of old buildings that have been reclaimed into excellent, affordable, semi-outdoor restaurants with a fun nightlife. My client found it easy to get to the Elizabeth and pick me up; and the taxi to and from the airport is a brisk 20 minutes or so (usually, the P.I.E. to C.T.E., or the alternative route using the E.C.P.; I've had taxis take both routes and it's almost always S$20). The facility is fine, but not glamorous. The breakfast buffet never changes (a big negative in my mind). The rooms are a bit small and the bathrooms even smaller. But every room has a desk, CNN on the flat screen TV; the rooms are clean, everything works like a champ, and the staff work hard to be friendly and inviting. So for the US$150 or so a night, you get a clean, safe, modern facility right in the heart of Singapore, three blocks from the Marriott and the Hilton and probably 1/3rd the price. Personally, I think it's a great value. A special kudo to the fellow working the bar -- he's there every night it seems. I was sitting by the pool enjoying a smoke and a scotch about 11pm, and an Australian lady walked in who had just landed after a much-delayed flight from Shanghai. Even though the kitchen was closed, this fellow went back to the kitchen, rousted them out and made her a bit of dinner. It wasn't fancy, but they really went out of their way to help her. Thats the kind of service that really means something to me -- because everybody gets delayed flights, and these folk really helped. Another little success story -- I needed a 5am wake-up call one morning, and I had mentioned to the desk clerk I could not be late for this pick-up. Not only did they call me, they called me again 15 mins later to make sure I had not fallen back to sleep. Again, it's a little thing, but an important sense of caring. BTW -- the Elizabeth has a sister hotel, the Quincy, right next to it; much more modern, hip and stylish. I've never stayed there, but I've heard no complaints, so I suspect it's a good choice too. Overall, this is not the place to stay for a resort visit with beaches and plam trees. But if you're on business in Singapore, it's a far better value than Traders, Excelsior or Fairmont, and I've stayed at all of them and others besides. I'll be coming back to the Elizabeth every time.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with good location , if you dont mind the walk”
Reviews.Author: NuttyNutt
Reviews.Content: Room is small due but if you don't really stay in the room, it shouldnt really matter. One thing i really noticed is that, the wash basin in the bathroom was mouldy at the sides. I tried to scrap it with wet tissue and it came off. Told the receptionist to tell the housekeeping to clear it, but they didnt even do it. So it was rather yucky. Dont look outside the window as you may see the window is rather dirty and some smeared paints as well. Finishing is just not there. The que for breakfast room was long on the 2nd day we were there. My suggestion to them is to open up the area next to the pool as to have breakfast outdoor is ok as it is covered as well. Front office staffs could be more friendly but maybe they were not to us, as we are just from a neighbouring country. Location is good , but could be tiring if you have a long day outside as to walk up with your shopping goods or children in tow. I dont mind the walking. I would only recommend this hotel to someone who wants to be near orchard road for shopping only as i dont quite like the front office staff services.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CliffDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights while I was in Singapore on business. Great location and I have no complaints about cleanliness in particular. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful and the broadband in the bedroom was quite fast for a reasonable price. My only slightly negative comment would be that the buffet breakfast was a bit limited in choice.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: THEEHETE
Reviews.Content: We changed rooms 2 times as aircon was not working and the room on the smoking floor smelled smoky - really no mirracle! The room we ended up with had 2 single beds instead of one queensize bed. All rooms that we saw were dirty, lots of long hair in the bathromm...

Reviews.Title: “A Singapore Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Vonhagar
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and 21 year old daughter spent one night in the Hotel during a stopover. It is a nice quiet and convenient location just off Orchard Road. Whilst the room was not large it was adequate in size for our needs - we only had our aircraft carry on luggage -with large cases we may have been a little crammed. The room was clean, the beds comfortable, the towels fluffy, the shower/bathroom fine. Walk down the hill to the Paragon Hotel and you will find a supermarket in the basement where you can buy your snacks and drinks during your stay. Very friendly staff - no problems at all and would stay again at The Elizabeth.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: rlsenf
Reviews.Content: This was my first stop on a 12 night visit to Singapore and Malaysia. I chose it for location and price as I wanted to be near the Orchard Road area and MRT. I was not disappointed. I was able to check in shortly after noon. Check in went smooth;y and my room was clean and serviced properly during my two day stay. Two areas to note- 1 The "fitness center" was outdoors and had just a couple of machines. If I was staying more than two nights I would look for better fitness facilies. 2. I had emailed the hotel prior to arrival to see if the concierge could assit with transportation to Melaka and was told they could. Not so. They will just book a day trip excursion. I don't do hotel food when I travel so I can't comment on those facilities. For me it was agood value for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlVJT
Reviews.Content: Small but cozy rooms, this hotel is in a great location just a few blocks from the heart of Orchard. Rooms were clean, great fitness and pool amenities. Nice staff and good service.

Reviews.Title: “The Elizabeth Hotel - Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Babunipun
Reviews.Content: The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. Its is a 10 mins walk to the Orchad Road so it was very convinient The hotel provides Airport transfers. A free boat ride in the river in the evening. Restaurants are great. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in on holiday and I am extremely fussy!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Ok - pretty average but good location”
Reviews.Author: makinupforlosttime
Reviews.Content: We have had a two night stay at this hotel. The hotel is pretty average - you basically get what you paid for apart from the breakfast which I thought was pretty dissapointing. Everthing was cold, the choce of bread and fruit was limited. The bedroomsare pretty small with poor lighting in the room. However, I have not stayed in Singapore before so it is difficult to evaluate if we got value for money as in my opinion it was still rather pricey. On the plus side very quiet and the bedroom/bathroom though dated was clean. Housekeeping staff very pleasant and the receiption staff efficient at check in. Great location a short walk only to Orchard Road. There is a Supermarket pretty near to the hotel (In the basement of the Paragon Building) so we were able to shop rather than pay silly prices for odds and ends on Orchard Road or the Hotel. We found a great food hall in the Lucky Plaza (again not too far from the hotel) which was excellent and soo cheap. One problem we did have was we wanted to use our laptop and use the hotels Wifi connection which you had to connect with the jackpoint in the room so it could be charged to your bill. Each room supposedly is provided with a lead for this purpose - ours was in the desk drawer. It was about 2 feet too short - trying to explain this to the technical staff was a nightmare - when someone eventually came to the room he said 'Oh, we will need a longer connection'!!!!!!!!!!! Surely they must have checked it/we can't have been the first ones to use it? Anyhow a minor issue but something to be aware of. Singapore was great and well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and helpful. customer interer's first”
Reviews.Author: jjchs
Reviews.Content: Very courteous, friendly and helful personnel at the front desk. Quick response from hosekeeping requests.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to relax after tired shopping day”
Reviews.Author: petitini
Reviews.Content: Great value, nice and quite place just 5 minutes on foot to the Orchard road though it's sometimes quite hard to find taxi.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: thomaGermany
Reviews.Content: we called to the hotel n made a reservation.upon arrival,we were told the price quoted over the phone DOES NOT EXIST!i told them,we were quoted 130++ WITHOUT BREAKFAST and its a STANDARD ROOM!i told a lady on the phone its okay with 130++ and i even asked for a double bed.she explained she cant promise a double bed in a standard room! when we arrived,they seem to force us to pay for 160++ saying the 130++ NEVER EXIST! the lady said we couldnt cancel the room as its already due.so we had NO CHOICE! staffs were so VERY UNFRIENDLY! they made is sounds like its our mistake!!! NO airport transfer,which is not normal for nowadays(most of the hotels provide transfers based on sharing basis). there is a big CONSTRUCTION just BESIDE the pool,so do not think of using the pool!! rooms are dirty,bathroom is extremely small,the bathtub doesnt flow!! we ordered for change of towels but no one came. we had to call again after 30mins !!! the mini bar was not working.we ordered a BUCKET of ice. we got a MUG of ice instead!! VERY HORRIBLE STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: jatingandhi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one day at this hotel. Great location near Orchard road, Good size exec rooms, beds comfortable, breakfast staff were great willing to please.Nice Restaurant. Could have stayed longer to enjoy the amenities. Pool was a blessing after a whole day out in the heat and a cool off. They even offered use of shower at departure time having already checked out. On the negative side is the view from the windows as a large construction is going on next door. I will definatelly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: SSling21
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel at the last minute but it was a gem! It's clean, in a fantastic location and we had wonderful service. They very kindly upgraded us to an executive room which was lovely. The service was prompt and friendly. If you have children, the huge pool is a haven after been out all day. We will definitely return to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely NOT be back”
Reviews.Author: extremisjae
Reviews.Content: Yes it was F1 week but no excuse. The hotel tried to move us to a sister hotel in Bugis because apparently they had overbooking issues. We had already prepaid all the accomodation months in advance and were not happy. Then they had the audacity to say the only room they had left was one with two single beds. We were on our Honeymoon! After less than 5 minutes the hotel magically found us a room with a double bed. By this point I expected an upgrade but since they had a standard double bed room available within 5 minutes it was obvious that they they lied so that they could use our room for a walk in who would pay top dollar! Not impressed, will never come back again. Everything else in S'pore was great but this hotel was the sour point.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, Rooms were very small. Probably wouldnt stay there again”
Reviews.Author: BombayBloke
Reviews.Content: Was in Singapore for work so stayed at Elizabeth after I checked out of Mandarin where i stayed for work. I chose Elizabeth as it was close to Orchard Road and I was staying back mainly to shop. The rooms were very small, which I could overlook as I was alone so it didnt matter. What irritated me was that the controls for most things didnt work. The master switch wasnt working. the reading light by the desk wasnt working. Finally, when i wanted to go to sleep, i couldnt seem to switch off the main control as the switchboard came off. Had to call housekeeping to ask them to fix it. It was going to take time, and i was tired so I had to tell them to come again in the morning. A couple of times, I wanted something from housekeeping and nobody would answer the phone. I was too tired to go down and ask them for help so i let it be and went to sleep. I wouldnt stay there again. At Rs 12,000 odd for two days without any breakfast i didnt think the place was cheap to warrant excusing such terrible service. Wouldnt recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Better stay somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: Airline_officer
Reviews.Content: Room was very small. Bathroom was super super small (Singaporian hotel size actually) Bed was comfy. Good location was good cuz near Orchard Rd., Not too far from the airport and nightlife. Staff were nice but front officers suppose to standby at the lobby whole nite but I didn't see them when I came back hotel late at nite!

Reviews.Title: “Not ultra modern, but good value”
Reviews.Author: ismaelCanberra
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple of nights in the Elizabeth during a recent visit to Singapore. While not as new as some others, it represents good value by Singapore standards. Staff were most helpful - including arranging for my room to be available early (by 10am) after an overnight flight from Europe. The pool is good but (as at Sept 2009) is presently surrounded by major construction on the adjoining block.

Reviews.Title: “great service from hotel staff!”
Reviews.Author: mr_jr123
Reviews.Content: The staff at The Elizabeth was great! They are so helpful and friendly. My wife and I was on our honeymoon and the staff has upgraded us for FREE! They was also nice enough to give us a room for 30min to shower before our long flights to Europe even though we have checked out that morning. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nana_nomad
Reviews.Content: I was there for a week with my mom and my sister. Good price and easy access to Orchard Road. I will stay there, if I'm visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: IMPCTraveler
Reviews.Content: I mostly agree with all the previous posts - both positive and negative. I checked in and the first room I was given was warm and had a moldy smell to it, went back to the front desk and the woman was very gracious, asked no questions and gave me another room. Same problem, the next time she seemed embarrassed and then gave me an "upgrade" to an executive room, which was better. But, the air conditioning could not be turned down - which explained why it didn't have the moldy smell of the first 2. Fixtures need some updating and the carpet was worn, but the price for the area was good. The pool looked ok, but didn't use it. The "gym" was 4 machines outside by the pool, under a shelter. There is construction going next door, but on the 7th floor, it wasn't too bothersome. The mattress was more of a futon, which was great for me as I like a firmer mattress. Free water in the room was a bonus. All in all, the previous reviews were pretty accurate - the rooms are different, so don't be shy to ask for another should you not like the first one you get.

Reviews.Title: “I will certainly go back.”
Reviews.Author: DuctTrav
Reviews.Content: If you are a businessman like me and looking for some place where you can retreat to after a day of hassle and meetings. You can definitely settle in to Elizabeth. I would dearly recommend to all business travellers. Good reception and fantastic quiet ambient.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel close to Orchard”
Reviews.Author: shamu99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last Jun 2009. The directions was quite misleading or maybe it's because our friends GPRS wasnt working well. Our accomodation included daily bfast and our lunch and dinner would always be outsde the hotel. It is very close to Orchard Rd (abt 10 minutes) therefore you can check different restaurants there. And so are the shopping mall. The thing I liked best in this hotel is the swimming pool, the best time is in the morning because you can do ur sunbathing and not too many ppl uses the pool. They have a small fitness gym (open air) right beside the pool. The daily BUFFET bfast is also okay (except that they served the same set of dishes for the 3 mornings we were there). Front desk, bell boys and security are also accomodating and courteous. Our room was okay not so fancy and always clean. Over all we enjoyed our stay in Singapore and at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I would come back if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: DingLoo
Reviews.Content: The overall service is good, letting us made an early check in and late check out. The hotel staffs are quite helpful. The room size is standard, but most importantly is clean. The location wise is about 10 minutes walk to Orchard Road and about 15 minutes walk to Orchard MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “if only there are restaurant and supermarket nearby”
Reviews.Author: Senjamerah
Reviews.Content: Value for money, however no restaurant or supermarket nearby, means we had to go down and find one at Orchard Road. You have to climb back as well to return to hotel, which made it difficult.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and excellent”
Reviews.Author: AGARWALGIR
Reviews.Content: you should add some more vegetrain food on your menu

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay with friendly and caring service”
Reviews.Author: Hellen63
Reviews.Content: We had a nice time at the Hotel. A quick check-in and check-out with a very friendly and helpful service staff. The rooms are clean and tidy and very comfortable. The swimmingpool is clean and nice with palms sourrounding. At the moment there is construction work beside the hotel, but it did not disturb us at all.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: AVMAustralia
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Singapore with my mother and husband as a stopover on the way to Europe. We were there for two nights. The hotel is great too look at and the rooms are very well equipped however a few odd things happened. We booked for 3 and arrived to find two twin beds. They insisted on squeezing in a roll out bed, which made it almost impossible to move in the room. They were over accommodating but it would have been simpler to give us another room. They had two towels and on the first night never did get the third towel. We couldn't turn the air con and it was freezing. To top it off, when I tried to turn off the light, the whole switch fell out of the wall. Despite the comedy of errors which I see as bad luck, the hotel is cheaper than those on Orchard Road and extremely close. Some say the uphill climb to the hotel is not all that convenient. This didn't didn't bother us, including my 68 year old mother. Location was fabulous. Public transport is also nearby. There is a restaurant, a little pricey. There is a bar and great pool area where you can be served from the bar. The wifi was great in the room. I still would stay there again for convenience of locatioan and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: lovetoreviewtrips
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Elizabeth Hotel for three days, rooms were utterly horrible, changed rooms everyday of the stay in hopes to find an acceptable one, but to no avail. The walls in the rooms were dirty, and had mildew stains on bathroom walls. The hallways of the hotel had offensive stench that were unbearable, the staff were untrained, spoke poor English, and very unhelpful. I would never ever stay at this hotel again. And I would never suggest any of my friends or family to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location abit misleading”
Reviews.Author: maymay777
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Elizabeth hotel for a total of 3 nights in the Deluxe room on the 8th floor. The price online was quite competitive (SGD170 a night inclusive breakfast and internet connection) so we went ahead and booked it, seeing that on the MAP it was so close to Orchard Road. I guess we forgot one detail; that The Elizabeth was on MOUNT ELIZABETH, which doesn't sound very encouraging at all now that I think about it. Yeap you get the drift, the hotel is basically at the top of this hill which looked short on plan. It took about 10 minutes in the HEAT to walk into the Paragon Shopping Mall, and climbing up the hill 2 times a day was seriously a stress test for the heart. Orchard Road wasn't that great for shopping anyways (things weren't good value, construction everywhere, dusty, etc) so the only redeeming factor it would have is if it was close to an MRT station. The Orchard MRT station was a good 25-30 minute walk from the hotel, so please be prepared for this if you want to stay here. Cabs however will be easy to take as on the way down the hill, there are these medical centres with taxi stops. Yup there's construction going on right beside the building, but I wasn't bothered by it too much. I don't spend an awful lot of time staring out my hotel window. =P The complimentary breakfast was a downer. Even the omelette tasted WEIRD like thin plastic discs. I don't know what went wrong there. We asked for coffee TWICE, only to be served TEA. We said explicitly 'COF- FEE' again but the waiters came back after 2 minutes confirming if we wanted tea? *pulls hair* The orange and fruit juices were from cordial concentrates, but I won't complain too much as breakfast was complimentary with the room. All in all, rooms are clean and the room was gorgeous (newly refurbished I think, everything was quite new). The bed was good! And we got papers every morning. A perfectly functioning TV too with satellite TV reception. However, on the down side, the staffs are generally clueless and don't seem very experienced. For that price 'near' Orchard Road I'd recommend The Elizabeth. But I bet you can get much cheaper rooms away from Orchard Road near to the MRT which takes you anywhere in Singapore anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not really liking it...”
Reviews.Author: Rich630
Reviews.Content: Last time I was living in Quincy (in my another review) which was next to it and this time we were living in Elizabeth Hotel becoz of its slightly better room rate and value-added services (limousine to & from the airport, etc). The room and the bed was okay - no complaints. But I really hated the buttons for controlling the lights and power - simply inconvenient. The Internet speed was bloody slow. The staff was okay but not nice I would say.

Reviews.Title: “Next to a construction site”
Reviews.Author: oceancreature
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, early June 09, on nightstop in Singapore. Hotel reasonable well located (just off Orchard Road)- but was next to a construction site - didn't realize until it all started up about 730 am (on a Saturday!). I would say that unless you're a deep sleeper you would probably have difficulty sleeping through it. For your information, looks like the construction is in its early stages, so will probably be around for a while. I looked at floorplan of hotel- and it looks like most of it faces the site so you may struggle to find a room thats away from it. However- having said that, there may be areas of the hotel I'm unaware of. Swimming pool is nice, and the rooms are reasonable (we got a free upgrade)- though they are a bit tired looking, and the furniture is something like at my grandparents. However they are spacious. Staff were mixed- the guy who checked us in, at night, was an unhappy soul, but the morning staff were very friendly and helpful. If it wasn't for the noise, I would give it a 'reasonable' recommendation- but until the construction is over- its an 'avoid'.

Reviews.Title: “ask for the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: geo16
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a one night stop over - colleague had been there the week before and recommended it.
