I had booked the cheapest room - which other reviewers have described as small. When I booked in they upgraged me at no extra cost (I was going to ask on the advice of my friend). My room was on the 10th floor, huge, fabulous marble bathroom, free wireless internet, and ironing board and iron (which I always consider a big plus, but is getting rare these days), bathroom scales and expresso coffee machine (which i didnt use). One gripe, although they did have tea making facilities they only had one type of tea and no milk, only instant creamer. I would also suggest against taking the shuttle bus from the airport (9 dollars) if you are tired and just want to get to the hotel. I was the last person dropped off - did get a tour of Singapore - so it took over and hour and a half to get from the airport. For the extra ten dollars the 20 minute taxi ride may be more convenient for some.

Reviews.Title: “3 Stars, Not 4”
Reviews.Author: AndrewGF
Reviews.Content: Although far from great, this hotel is not as bad as some of the reviews suggest. The main point about it is that it is only a 3 star hotel, not 4 stars as advertised. As many reviews have commented, the rooms are quite small. Also, the hotel engages in misleading advertising, by using the term 'superior' to describe its lowest level room. My booking said the room would contain one double bed and one single bed, yet when I checked in, it contained two single beds only. When I queried this, the manager said he would swap one of the single beds for a double bed. The trouble with this was that the room was so small that the only way of fitting in a single and double bed would be to remove the desk, which was a standard feature of the room. In other words, the room was too small to realistically contain a single and double bed. The location is not as bad as claimed in some of the reviews. It is a five minute walk from the heart of Orchard Road. Although the walk from Orchard Road to the hotel is up a moderate slope, the slope is not nearly as steep as some of the reviews suggest, and should not pose a problem for any reasonably fit person under 60. For the money, there are a number of better hotels. If they reduced the price by 10-15%, I would almost recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: mossleytrippers
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a stopover. Arrived very early in the morning ie 7.30am. Were offered a room immediately for an extra 50 Sing. dollars or return at 11am - this is fair enough. You can't expect to check in so early it's practically still the night before! Wandered round Orchard Road looking for a coffee - a few open but malls don't open fully til 10-10.30am. Room was okay - whole hotel looking a little tired though. Staff were helpful enough I found. The walk to Orchard Road is only about 5/10mins, although it is a bit uphill on the way back. Not a problem if you don't have to have your hotel right on the doorstep of everything else. We arrived back one night at about 10.30pm to find the bar shut! What??! They have a pool table in the bar and it seemed to be decorated with loads of Arsenal stuff. Check out is 1pm - fair enough. OUr flight was late in the evening so asked if we could take a shower. Yes, but turned out it was the pool shower. THis is enclosed and separate for men/women but no air con so you get a bit warm and very basic (push button shower that lasts only a few seconds each time and cool water, not hot) and no soap/toilet roll. However, once I got used to the water not being warm it was actually rather refreshing.! Also,anyone could walk in and you could find yourself getting dressed in front of a complete stranger - like at your local swimming baths. Still, better than nothing. I agree that there are probably better hotels to stay in that offer the same rate. Fab new hotel nearly open next door called Quincy. I would check that out although I imagine much more expensive. Building site next door although didn't work on a Sunday and started at about 8am Monday. Not noisy though as windows well glazed but covered in green stuff on the outside!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: LastSamurai
Reviews.Content: The Elizabeth is overprized for what it offers. The room was ok, but certainly not 4-star. Most annoying were the exhorbitant charges for internet use when you expect it to be included in a place like Singapore. Staff are mostly on auto-pilot, don't expect extra charm. Location is a problem too, because for access to Orchard road you have to walk around a whole block. Not recommended for business travellers and much better deals available for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Terrible, Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Travelor42
Reviews.Content: During our business stay, we moved to 3 different rooms before finally finding another hotel in Singapore. Our story seems to have been quite common for guests at this hotel. The first room was the size of a tiny box, I think they put everyone there first, just to see who will actually stay . The ceiling in the bathroom fell thru one night when it rained, and the floor was covered with water and some black stuff like mold or something, and the third room smelled so bad that we just gave it up! Some say that patients from the hospital down the street stay there too, and some said the smell was ether, who knows. The management there could care less, their solution to any problem that you had was to simply move you to another empty room. That is if they ever bothered to answer the phone. Normally, you would just have to go to the front desk. One morning, I returned from breakfast to find my door left open by maybe housekeeping, the manager stood there looking at me, trying to understand why that would be upseting to a guest. I actually saw a staff member walking down the hall with a bundle of inscense, probabally trying to hide the smell there. When they saw me, they began to run down the hall, pretty sceary. Then there was the housekeeper that insisted that he remembered me from the time before when I was sick..... And last but not least, dont count on the internet working alot there either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Tourist”
Reviews.Author: mruvi
Reviews.Content: Located only about a few kilometers from Singapore's famous shopping area, Orchard Road, The Elizabeth is very convinient for tourists. We stayed at the hotel during the first Singapore Formula 1 nightrace. It only takes us a few minutes to go to the F1 circuit. Although is an old Hotel, it still very well maintained and very clean. The room is just right for couples but it would be too small for travellers with children. We were travelling there during the months of Ramadan. But unfortunately the hotel does not provide early breakfast for their muslim guests. Not even coffee or tea with sandwitch or muffin which in some hotels in Singapore usually provided for guests who is taking a very early flights.But fortunately there is a nearby mosque, Al-Falah which conduct a night prayers and provide a free breakfast. The overall service is very good and the staff is also very friendly. They also dressed up in sport shirt and caps during the race events.

Reviews.Title: “Total Mistake”
Reviews.Author: RonPerthWA
Reviews.Content: I am a little surprised at the good reviews that this hotel has received. The Elizabeth hotel, considering the price, is overly priced for what it is and a huge disappointment. Negatives: - Nobody helped us bring our luggage to our room. - When we got to our room there was sand and wet towels all over the bed, sandals in the bin and the bathroom was wet. They gave us a room that wasn’t even cleaned. - Hotel staff are not very friendly though they are quite efficient and polite. - Construction is nearby and it is noisy by 8am - We stayed at an executive suite, however, the room was very small, dated and drab. I hate to think what a standard room is like. - Even though it is just off Orchard Road, you need to walk up a hill (in the humidity) to get to the hotel. - The air-conditioning doesn’t work properly and you can not set the settings. The room was so cold; I got sick on the way to Hong Kong. I am not sure why this hotel is considered a four star hotel which charges around $250 (AUD) per night. I have stayed at cheaper hotels in Singapore which is of better quality. The only good thing about this hotel is the Italian Restaurant on the ground floor. It is quite nice and the staff are vey friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and experience”
Reviews.Author: Kentraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with 15 y/o son stayed 4 nights. No problems from check in to check out. Courteous staff, great breakfast and service. Location was only a few minutes walk to Orchard road, exactly where I wanted to be. Would definately stay there again . Great swimming pool, gift shop, and internet for 1 Singapore dollar for 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cynicor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over an Aussie long weekend in March this year, for 7 nights. 4 of us had 2 rooms, a double and a twin. Overall a good experience and pretty good value. The location was great, being a cheap hotel only 5 minutes walk from the main part of Orchard Rd (between Paragon and Lucky Plaza). While other cheap hotels might be on Orchard, they generally have a longer walk to get to the big malls and the most modern part of Orchard/Scotts. The hotel is small, and over the road from the York, another 4 star. The Elizabeth is slightly better however and if the prices were the same or very close I would rather stay at the Elizabeth. The rooms were small but comfortable for the price and the bathrooms were quite small with a combined showerbath. The bed was comfortable but again nothing special. Just a 'normal' room with a 'normal' bed, minibar, tv and safe. We didn't eat at the hotel, but nearby are the 'touristy' food outlets in lucky plaza. These are clean and cheap (4-6SGD a dish) and excellent, but still pricey by local standards. The other nearby malls have nicer restaurants so there is no shortage of good food, or shopping. The staff are helpful and friendly and the pool was average. All up a good 4star that I would not hesitate to stay in again if I wanted a cheap hotel with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away... Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dubai38
Reviews.Content: 2 Nights stay at the the Elizabeth Hotel, being a regular traveller to Singapore we recently stayed at the Elizabeth Hotel… Stay away, this hotel is one of the worst I have stayed at in Singapore it was $210AUD which is not cheap, the rooms are small, they smell & the hotel is old.. Because the room was so bad we where going to check out, because we booked directly with the hotel, they would not refund, so we had to stay, we had to pay an extra SIN$75.00 for a room that was better….It was not much better !!!! Stay at The York across the road same price & far better service, rooms & overall experience better…

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: spoiltbrat69
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many 5 star hotels in Singapore and going now for just a quick weekend we thought we'd go down market so to speak (pardon the incredible arrogance here) and book a 4 star hotel for a change. If it's taught me anything it's that we've been overspending on our past trips to Singapore as I didn't really miss anything we would have had in the other hotels. The service was good, the people friendly, rooms well-appointed and clean and we had a really nice relaxed time. It doesn't quite have the luxurious opulent feeling of a Shangri-La or Raffles of course, but it's very good value for money and we would come back next time - and spend the savings on shopping or food!! Breakfast was nice, if a bit on the basic side variety-wise. The restaurant staff were very friendly and extremely helpful with the kids. We didn't have any other meals at Modesto's (the Italian restaurant where breakfast is served as well) apart from some kids dinners and they were very good, as was the room service tomato & mozzarella salad and chicken dish that we had. There is also a pub next to the pool and drinks/snacks are served at the pool (small but nice enough with plenty of loungers around it) The location is very convenient, a 5 min walk from Orchard Road and the Mount Elizabeth Hospital is on the way there - very handy for us as one of our kids always seems to end up sick on our travels!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Californiatraveller7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elizabeth Hotel on our way back to New York from a two week trip through Thailand and Cambodia. I was actually pleasantly surprised by how comfortable the hotel was. Yes, it is a bit of an early- to mid-80's time warp (70's is an exaggeration). However, the room was well-sized, well-appointed and meticulously clean. Personally, I didn't think it was in dire need of an update like some have suggested nor did we hear any noise. Check-in was a breeze and the concierge was very helpful in helping us contact a friend in Singapore for dinner. A small problem with our room was resolved almost instantly. Since our rate didn't include breakfast, we can't comment on it. One thing to note is that the hotel is a bit of a hike uphill from the Orchard Road shopping district and a 15-minute walk to the Orchard MRT station. If you are taking taxis everywhere, this is irrelevant but you should bear this in mind if you need to stay on Orchard Road (i.e., stay at Regent, Hilton or Marriott). This is probably why the hotel is lower priced than its nearby competition. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the 1970s”
Reviews.Author: Beo26
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Elizabeth last weekend and felt I was in a time warp back in the 1970s. Decor badly in need of an update, right down to the (rusting) bottle cap opener screwed to the bathroom cabinet and the non-functional radio in the bedroom night table. IT was less than "groovy" however, becasue I ended up paying over $150 for a very basic room. I know accommodations in Singapore have got very pricey, but this was not good value for the money - even after I requested and received a change to a supposedly renovated room. A better bet would be to stay at the YMCA.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, decent surrounding area”
Reviews.Author: aghman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work recently and was pleasantly surprised by the Elizabeth. The beds were comfy, the amenities were good, and the water pressure in the shower was tremendous. Good enough to mention online? Yep. I only tried the restaurant downstairs for breakfast, and because it was free (since we got vouchers). Otherwise I wouldn't suggest eating it. It's a relatively short walk to Orchard Road, and all the shopping contained therein. It's easy to get a cab and about 5 minutes away from the Orchard Road MRT station, so getting around from this hotel is very simple. Overall, I would recommend it if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Nyonya
Reviews.Content: The Elizabeth is moderately priced for its location and the staff are very helpful, but the decor is very gloomy and desperately needs updating. Also, the building next door is being demolished extremely noisily. The work starts promptly at 8am so there is no chance of a lie-in.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good despite building site next door!”
Reviews.Author: Wynn07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elizabeth for three nights as a stopover from New Zealand. Our initial thoughts were 'oh dear - next to a building site!' But truthfully unless you were stood outside the hotel during the day, you didn't notice the building site. On entry to the foyer the hotel looked great. Lots of marble and smart looking counter staff. However the hotel was looking a bit jaded round the edges. Our room was quite dark even with all the lights on. But the bedding was spotless and the room was cleaned daily. We had breakfast a couple of days but it wasn't cheap and some of the concoctions were strange to say the least (chicken porridge?) - however we were in a foreign country so we realised that things would be different to what we were used to. Orchard Road shopping area was very close and we were able to walk there in five minutes, (two minutes at a dash when it was raining!). All in all not a bad place to stay for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: eeb82
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for somewhere to lay your head and that is all then this is a good hotel. We stayed here three nights and only spent enough time in hotel to sleep and shower. The hotel is average nothing spectacular, but the location is great especially for the price. The hotel is just a very short walk to Orchard rd. and a short cab ride to places like Clarke Quay and Little India. I would recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and looking for a good location near Orchard rd.

Reviews.Title: “Lost its charm”
Reviews.Author: Ozzaboz
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at The Elizabeth 10 years ago & again in April 06. Our first stay was fantastic. The hotel was clean & had fantastic facilities, which is the reason why we returned in 2006. Upon our return, we discovered that the lovely french restuarant was replaced by a sports bar & the cocktail lounge was replaced by a cheap breakfast buffet restuarant. The rooms looked tired & the general maintenance lacked. The location is good even if you do have to walk up a hill after being tired from shopping in Lucky Plaza! Next time I am in Singapore, I think I will find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: christianmp
Reviews.Content: The Elizabeth is a decent hotel. Which is unfortunate because I believe that it was probably a very nice hotel about 5-7 years ago. The rooms are decently appointed but it is time that the company reinvest some money into the place. There are scuff marks on the paint, doors and gouges out of the wallpaper in the hallways. My shower had mold in the grout and in the corners of the tub and on the floor. It was nothing terrible but it was noticeable. The hotel is one of the cheaper hotels in Singapore and it's a good thing because it is not up to par with other properties in the city. The service was adequate, friendly and fairly efficient. The hotel is owned by the same group that owns the Orchard Parade hotel. I have stayed at the Orchard Parade on four separate occasions 98, 00, 02, and 04. During that time I watched that hotel go from very nice place to a place that needed some serious attention. Given the similarity between the properties, I believe that the corporate management is probably to blame for the neglect of both properties.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Dew_Eastern
Reviews.Content: Not a terrible hotel, although I have seen better. The room was quite nice and clean, but there were ants walking on the wall... Breakfast was quite nice, and the swimming pool is comfortable. A ten minute walk from the Orchard st., it is well located. All in all, a reasonable hotel, but you can probably find better ones. Dew.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgkhoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in September. Location-wise, it isn't really a short hop and step to Orchard Road. The hotel is located up a hill, and though not too tedious a walk, it can get rather sweaty in the humidity of Singapore. We had a car with us and had complimentary parking in a dank narrow underground hotel car park which just didn't feel secure at all. The lobby was tiny and the wait for service was lengthy. The room itself was cramped and dated, with windows facing a neighbouring sterile condiminium complex. The bathroom was not at all impressive, and construction began early in the morning, waking us every day. The biggest problem with our stay was the hotel's lack of honesty in relation to our safe deposit box. It wasn't working from the outset, and when queried, they sent a technician up who said it'd be fixed within the day. This carried on for 4 further days and we had to constantly remind them each day. Finally, they told us it wouldn't be fixed for the duration of our stay. Only when I complained did they offer me another room, which I felt they should have done from the outset. I wouldn't return again. There are much better hotels out there for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading...”
Reviews.Author: dunmac88
Reviews.Content: After looking at the hotel website I was lead to believe that the hotel was the perfect choice. However once I arrived I was surprised at how small the hotel really was. The lobby was just a 'waiting room' with only 4 seating spots...so most people would be standing around waiting with nowhere to sit. It seems the photos showed what looked to be a more newly renovated standard room than the one I had been given. The room felt small and the single beds were ridiculously undersized. The breakfast was average but with a fairly decent variety. The atmosphere of the restaurant was a little dated...It seemed we were back in the 80's and by the looks of things it probably hadn't been renovated since then. One good thing to say about the hotel is its location with shopping centres such as the 'Paragon' in easy walking distance. Overall the hotel isn't nececerilly a disasterous but i'd only recommend the hotel to short term staying.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: sam63
Reviews.Content: The location was great, only a couple of minutes walk into Orchard Rd. We were travelling with a 4 year old. When we booked we were told the beds were queen size but upon arriving we were given the choice of a double or 2 singles. We took the double but found it too small for the 3 of us. Rang reception to see if I could get some linen so one of us could sleep on the floor ,we were sent 1 sheet and a dirty threadbare blanket. The rooms were quite dark and small. Reception staff not very friendly at all. Breakfast in comparison to what we had had in other motels on our trip was disappointing. Staff however were friendly and the coffee was great.

Reviews.Title: “All that you need”
Reviews.Author: Pomeozzy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short break in Singapore and spent another enjoyable week at The Elizabeth. OK it's at the top of the hill but who's that lazy that they can't walk the short distance to Orchard and the MRT. Breakfast was lovely - plenty to choose from and staff very friendly. Always enjoy the swimming pool after doing the rounds of the shops and there's a gym if you're especially keen on exercising!!! The bedrooms are adequately furnished and well maintained - no fusty smells - and the bathrooms tiled in black, white and brown. We have never had any problems with the staff at this hotel and have thoroughly enjoyed all three stays.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: BigTripper61
Reviews.Content: We booked the Elizabeth Hotel via Expedia and checked in on Sunday 8th April 07. There was extensive building work taking place immediately next door to the hotel and so we asked for a quiet room away from the building work. The hotel said it did not have a double or queen bed avaiable on a non-smoking floor and so we were allocated an extremely small twin for our first night's stay. We changed room the next day and whilst it was slightly larger and more comfortable, it was right next to the customer lifts and there was constant machine noise throughout the evening and night. The buffet breakfast was probably the worst we have experienced in terms of food choice and quality, and the surroundings were drab and uninspired. We were similarly disappointed when we ordered room service - our order was delivered 20 mins late, we didn't receive what we'd asked for, the portions were small and the food flavours were over-powering (garlic dressing on caesar salad). The hotel is in need of rennovation. For example the painted finish of the baths in both rooms were flaking to a significant extent and the over-bath shower heads were immovable and sprayed water all over the edge of the bath and the toilet when turned on. We decided to check out after three nights of a planned four night stay, and my partner rang reception to check whether there would be any penalty charges for leaving a day early. He was told that there would not be any charges, so we packed and went downstairs an hour later to check out. We were then told by staff that we would incur the full charge for our fourth night. We challenged this and spoke to John Yap, the hotel's Guest Service Manager. He listened to our comments and after some initial reluctance agreed to advise Expedia that the hotel would not be requesting payment for the fourth night and would ask them to refund us the charge (it had been prepaid at time of booking). Mr Yap was both patient and polite and his attempt at service recovery was the only positive experience during our stay at the Elizabeth Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: amsguy39
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at The Elizabeth. It was a mistake. The location is OK, but not as good as others write. A 10 minute walk to the nearest shop is too far in Singapore! The room was dirty. Dust everywhere. And we found blood (?) stains on the bed sheets. (twice) There are building works next door (at least until late 2008) with lots of noise. We woke up early every day we were there. Had a drink at the pool and paid $11 for an orange juice. A rip-off. Don't stay at The Elizabeth. There are far better hotels in Singapore for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rooms badly need refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: trevostar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near enough to Orchard road but not right on it so it is more quiet and feels more neighbourhoody, which is great. 3 minutes walk to the main part of Orchard road and MRT station. Sadly, that's where good things about this hotel stops. I had booked a non smoking room with one queen bed so I was not pleased to walk into a room that smelled of stale cigarettes with 2 twin beds. The room was very old, furniture looked like it was from the late 70s, TV didn't look much newer. But it was super small though, maybe that was supposed to be modern back when they got it in the 80s. I requested for a room change and they said yes they will be right up. I finally got it after falling asleep for a couple of hours waiting for them, literally, no kidding. The non smoking room I got was even smaller than the first one. Can't say I like the linen in this hotel. Duvet was very thin and bed was not very comfortable. Of course I would not be complaining about most of this had I not been expecting a 4 star hotel like expedia said it is, and had I not paid the price I paid. My Singaporean friends all said that I had been majorly overpaying and that if I wanted to, I could've stayed at the all newly renovated York Hotel right across the street for the same price or less. It's a shame that they had let the hotel get this old inside, given they are in a very good location and could do so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Very acceptable and friendly choice”
Reviews.Author: nred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elizabeth for three nights. Despite the other reviews which might scare you off, we found the staff friendly and very responsive, room was clean and in good shape, and only a few very minor issues. Whenever we called, someone was at our door in 5 minutes or less (e.g. extra blankets and pillows). This hotel is conveniently located to Orchard Road and Mt. Elizabeth Hospital and reasonably priced for Singapore. About the only drawback is that the bathtub was difficult to access for a senior---though there were plenty of grab bars.

Reviews.Title: “overall good value”
Reviews.Author: nobody123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Elizabeth for 2 days. Pro´s: It´s a quite nice hotel. Clean room (liitle small, but thats common in Singapore as I have read in many reviews) and friendly staff. It´s near the Orchard road, the "no.1" shopping -street. The famous japanese "Ngee Ann City" is just across the street on Orchard road. "Near" means, you have to walk up the "mount elizabeth" for 5 minutes, but don´t be afraid: it´s just a hill! There is also the MRT nearby. Con´s: I booked a non-smoker-room, but got a room on a smoker-floor - wasn´t too bad, but still: if you are sensitive to that it might be a problem. secondly: the breakfast: expensive (not included) and not of a good quality. Overall it was a good stay and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: EffCee
Reviews.Content: Great location. Easy walking distance to Orchard Road, the main shopping area. Rooms somewhat small but comfortable. Beware checking-in before at 14.00. We arrived at 02.00 and were charged for an extra day. Breakfast selection average and not very good value. If possible, stay over Christmas, the Xmas illuminations in Singapore are magnificent.

HotelInfo.Name: The Elizabeth Hotel by Far East Hospitality
HotelInfo.Address: 24 Mount Elizabeth, Singapore 228518, Singapore
